00143   {

00145       printf("%02X\n",((char*)p_res)[index]);

00154 /* used for keeping handle value after
00155  * freeing nfs res.
00156  */
00157 typedef struct shell_fh3__
00158 {
00159   u_int data_len;
00160   char  data_val[NFS3_FHSIZE];
00161 } shell_fh3_t;
00162 
00163 static void set_shell_fh3( shell_fh3_t * p_int_fh3, nfs_fh3 * p_nfshdl)
00164 {
00165   p_int_fh3->data_len = p_nfshdl->data.data_len;
00166   memcpy( p_int_fh3->data_val, p_nfshdl->data.data_val, p_nfshdl->data.data_len );
00167 } 
00168 
00169 static void set_nfs_fh3( nfs_fh3 * p_nfshdl, shell_fh3_t * p_int_fh3 )
00170 {
00171   p_nfshdl->data.data_len = p_int_fh3->data_len ;
00172   p_nfshdl->data.data_val = p_int_fh3->data_val;
00173 }

00210   {"nfs2",   NULL, "", "", 0},
00211   {"nfs3",   NULL, "", "", 0},

00221 CLIENT * getCLIENT(char * name      /* IN */
00222          ) 
00223 {
00224   prog_vers_client_def_t * clnts = progvers_clnts;
00225 
00226   while (clnts->name != NULL) {
00227     if ( !strcmp( clnts->name, name ) ) {
00228       return clnts->clnt;
00229     }
00230     clnts ++;
00231   }
00232   return NULL;
00233 } /* getCLIENT */
00234 
00235 
00237 int setCLIENT(char * name,  /* IN */
00238               CLIENT * clnt /* IN */
00239     ) 
00240 {
00241   prog_vers_client_def_t * clnts = progvers_clnts;
00242 
00243   while (clnts->name != NULL) {
00244     if ( !strcmp( clnts->name, name ) ) {
00245       clnts->clnt = clnt;
00246       return 0;
00247     }
00248     clnts ++;
00249   }
00250   return -1;
00251 } /* setCLIENT */
00252 
00253 
00255 char * getHostname(char * name  /* IN */
00256        )
00257 {
00258   prog_vers_client_def_t * clnts = progvers_clnts;
00259 
00260   while (clnts->name != NULL) {
00261     if ( !strcmp( clnts->name, name ) ) {
00262       return clnts->hostname;
00263     }
00264     clnts ++;
00265   }
00266   return "";
00267 } /* getHostname */
00268 
00269 
00271 int setHostname(char * name,  /* IN */
00272                 char * hostname  /* IN */
00273     )
00274 {
00275   prog_vers_client_def_t * clnts = progvers_clnts;
00276 
00277   while (clnts->name != NULL) {
00278     if ( !strcmp( clnts->name, name ) ) {
00279       clnts->hostname = (char*)strndup(hostname, HOST_NAME_MAX);
00280       return 0;
00281     }
00282     clnts ++;
00283   }
00284   return -1;
00285 } /* setHostname */
00286

00289 char * getProto(char * name  /* IN */
00290        )

00292   prog_vers_client_def_t * clnts = progvers_clnts;
00293 
00294   while (clnts->name != NULL) {
00295     if ( !strcmp( clnts->name, name ) ) {
00296       return clnts->proto;
00297     }
00298     clnts ++;
00299   }
00300   return "";
00301 } /* getProto */
00302 
00303 
00305 int setProto(char * name,  /* IN */
00306              char * proto  /* IN */
00307     )
00308 {
00309   prog_vers_client_def_t * clnts = progvers_clnts;
00310 
00311   while (clnts->name != NULL) {
00312     if ( !strcmp( clnts->name, name ) ) {
00313       clnts->proto = (char*)strndup(proto, 4);
00314       return 0;
00315     }
00316     clnts ++;
00317   }
00318   return -1;
00319 } /* setProto */
00320 
00321

00324     )
00325 {
00326   prog_vers_client_def_t * clnts = progvers_clnts;
00327 
00328   while (clnts->name != NULL) {
00329     if ( !strcmp( clnts->name, name ) ) {
00330       return clnts->port;
00331     }
00332     clnts ++;
00333   }
00334   return 0;
00335 } /* getPort */

00339 int setPort(char * name,  /* IN */
00340             int    port  /* IN */
00341     )
00342 {
00343   prog_vers_client_def_t * clnts = progvers_clnts;
00344 
00345   while (clnts->name != NULL) {
00346     if ( !strcmp( clnts->name, name ) ) {
00347       clnts->port = port;
00348       return 0;
00349     }
00350     clnts ++;
00351   }
00352   return -1;
00353 } /* setPort */

00372 
00374 int rpc_init(char * hostname, /* IN */
00375              char * name,     /* IN */
00376              char * proto,    /* IN */
00377              int    port,     /* IN */
00378              FILE * output    /* IN */
00379     )
00380 {
00381   int rc;
00382   u_long prog = 0;
00383   u_long vers = 0;
00384 
00385   CLIENT * clnt_res = NULL;
00386         struct hostent *h;
00387         struct protoent *p;
00388         struct sockaddr_in sin;
00389         int sock;
00390   struct passwd * pw_struct;
00391 #define MAX_GRPS  128
00392   gid_t   groups_tab[MAX_GRPS];
00393   int     nb_grp;
00394 
00395   prog_vers_def_t * progvers = progvers_rpcs;
00396   
00397   while ( progvers->name != NULL ) {
00398     if ( !strcmp( progvers->name, name ) ) {
00399       prog = progvers->prog;
00400       vers = progvers->vers;
00401       //fprintf(output, "(%s) Prog : %d - Vers : %d - Proto : %s\n", name, prog, vers, proto);
00402       h = gethostbyname(hostname);
00403       if (h == NULL) {
00404         rpc_createerr.cf_stat = RPC_UNKNOWNHOST;
00405         fprintf(output, "rpc_init : unknown host %s\n", hostname);
00406         return (-1);
00407       }
00408       if (h->h_addrtype != AF_INET) {
00409         /*
00410          * Only support INET for now
00411          */
00412         rpc_createerr.cf_stat = RPC_SYSTEMERROR;
00413         rpc_createerr.cf_error.re_errno = EAFNOSUPPORT; 
00414         return (-1);
00415       }
00416       memset(&sin, 0, sizeof(sin));
00417 
00418       sin.sin_family = h->h_addrtype;
00419       sin.sin_port = htons((u_short)port);
00420       memcpy((char*)&sin.sin_addr, h->h_addr, h->h_length);
00421       
00422       p = getprotobyname(proto);
00423       if (p == NULL) {
00424         fprintf(output, "rpc_init : protocol %s not found\n", proto);
00425         return (-1);
00426       }
00427       sock = RPC_ANYSOCK;
00428       
00429       switch (p->p_proto) {
00430         case IPPROTO_UDP:
00431           clnt_res = clntudp_bufcreate(&sin, prog, vers,
00432                          timeout, &sock, UDPMSGSIZE, UDPMSGSIZE);
00433           if (clnt_res == NULL) {
00434             fprintf(output, "rpc_init : Clntudp_bufcreate failed\n");
00435             return (-1);
00436           }
00437           break;
00438         case IPPROTO_TCP:
00439           clnt_res = clnttcp_create(&sin, prog, vers, &sock, 8800, 8800);
00440           if (clnt_res == NULL) {
00441             fprintf(output, "rpc_init : Clnttcp_create failed\n");
00442             return (-1);
00443           }
00444           break;
00445         default:
00446           rpc_createerr.cf_stat = RPC_SYSTEMERROR;
00447           rpc_createerr.cf_error.re_errno = EPFNOSUPPORT; 
00448           fprintf(output, "rpc_init : unknown protocol %d (%s)\n", p->p_proto, proto);
00449           return (-1);
00450       }
00451       
00452       if (current_pw == NULL) { // first rpc_init
00453         pw_struct = getpwuid(getuid()); 
00454         if ( pw_struct == NULL )
00455         {
00456           fprintf(output, "getpwuid failed\n");
00457           return -1;
00458         }
00459         current_pw = (struct passwd*)malloc(sizeof(struct passwd));
00460         memcpy(current_pw, pw_struct, sizeof(struct passwd));
00461       }
00462       nb_grp = getugroups( MAX_GRPS, groups_tab, current_pw->pw_name, current_pw->pw_gid );
00463 
00464       clnt_res->cl_auth = authunix_create(localmachine, current_pw->pw_uid, current_pw->pw_gid, nb_grp, groups_tab);
00465       if (clnt_res->cl_auth == NULL) {
00466         fprintf(stdout, "rpc_init : error during creating Auth\n");
00467       }
00468 
00469       rc = setCLIENT(name, clnt_res);
00470       if (rc != 0) {
00471         fprintf(output, "rpc_init : error during setCLIENT\n");
00472         return rc;
00473       }
00474       rc = setHostname(name, hostname);
00475       if (rc != 0) {
00476         fprintf(output, "rpc_init : error during setHostname\n");
00477         return rc;
00478       }
00479       rc = setProto(name, proto);
00480       if (rc != 0) {
00481         fprintf(output, "rpc_init : error during setProto\n");
00482         return rc;
00483       }
00484       rc = setPort(name, port);
00485       if (rc != 0) {
00486         fprintf(output, "rpc_init : error during setPort\n");
00487         return rc;
00488       }
00489 
00490       //fprintf(output, "rpc_init : %s client set (%s)\n", name, proto);
00491       return 0;
00492     }
00493 
00494     progvers ++ ;
00495   }
00496   
00497   fprintf(output,"rpc_init : %s: program not found\n",name);
00498   return -1;
00499 } /* rpc_init */
00500 
00501 
00503 int rpc_reinit(char * name,  /* IN */
00504                FILE * output /* IN */
00505     )
00506 {
00507   int rc;
00508   
00509   int port;
00510   char * proto;
00511   char * hostname;
00512  
00513   hostname = getHostname(name);
00514   if (strlen(hostname) == 0) {
00515     fprintf(output, "rpc_reinit client %s : getHostname failed\n", name);
00516     return -1;
00517   }
00518   proto = getProto(name);
00519   if (strlen(proto) == 0) {
00520     fprintf(output, "rpc_reinit client %s : getProto failed\n", name);
00521     return -1;
00522   }
00523   port = getPort(name);
00524 
00525   rc = rpc_init(hostname, name, proto, port, output);
00526   if (rc != 0) {
00527     fprintf(output, "rpc_reinit failed\n");
00528     return -1;
00529   }
00530 
00531   return rc;
00532 } /* rpc_reinit */
00533 
00534 
00536 int try_rpc_reinit(char * name,       /* IN */
00537                    int    error,      /* IN */
00538                    FILE * output      /* IN */
00539     )
00540 {
00541   unsigned int i;
00542 
00543   for (i=1; i<=MAXIT; i++) {
00544     if (rpc_reinit(name, output) == 0) break;
00545     if (i>=MAXIT) {
00546       return error;
00547     }
00548     sleep(1);
00549   }
00550   return 0;
00551 } /* try_rpc_reinit */
00552 
00553 
00554 int switch_result(int result,
00555                   int i,
00556                   char * name,
00557                   char * func_name,
00558                   char * func_called_name,
00559                   FILE * output
00560     )
00561 {
00562   int rc = 0;
00563   
00564   switch (result) {
00565     case RPC_SUCCESS:
00566       break;
00567     case RPC_CANTRECV:
00568     case RPC_TIMEDOUT:
00569       if (i < MAXRETRY) {
00570         rc = try_rpc_reinit(name, rc, output);
00571         if (rc == 0) return -1;
00572       }
00573       setCLIENT(name, NULL);
00574     default:
00575       fprintf(output,"Error %s (%d) in %s (%s).\n",clnt_sperrno(result), result, func_called_name, func_name);
00576       return result;
00577       break;
00578   }
00579   return 0;
00580 }
00581 
00582 
00584 static void getopt_init()
00585 {
00586   /* disables getopt error message */
00587   Opterr = 0;   
00588   /* reinits getopt processing */
00589   Optind = 1;  
00590 } /* getopt_init */
00591 
00592 
00594 int fn_rpc_init(     int argc ,      /* IN : number of args in argv */
00595                      char ** argv ,  /* IN : arg list               */
00596                      FILE * output   /* IN : output stream          */
00597     )
00598 {
00599   static char format[]="h";
00600   int flag_h   = 0;  
00601   int err_flag = 0 ;
00602   int option ;
00603   int rc;
00604 
00605   char * hostname = "";
00606   char * name  = "";
00607   char * proto = "";
00608   int port = 0;
00609 
00610   static char help_rpc_init[]=
00611   "usage: rpc_init [options] <hostname> <program_version> <protocol> [<port>]\n"
00612   "<hostname> : name, localhost, machine.mondomaine.com ...\n"
00613   "<program> : nfs2 / nfs3 / mount1 / mount3\n"
00614   "<protocol> : udp / tcp\n"
00615   "options :\n"
00616   "\t-h print this help\n";
00617 
00618   /* analysing options */
00619   getopt_init();
00620   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 ) {   
00621     switch( option ) {
00622       case 'h':
00623         if( flag_h )
00624           fprintf( output, "rpc_init: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n") ;
00625         else 
00626           flag_h++;
00627         break;
00628       case '?':
00629         fprintf( output, "rpc_init: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt ) ;
00630         err_flag ++;
00631         break;
00632     } /* switch */   
00633   } /* while */
00634   if( flag_h ) {
00635     fprintf( output, help_rpc_init );
00636     return 0;
00637   }
00638   
00639   /* verifies mandatory argument */
00640   if( Optind > ( argc - 3 ) || Optind < ( argc - 4 ) ) {
00641     /* too much or not enough arguments */
00642     err_flag ++;
00643   }
00644   else {
00645     hostname = argv[Optind];
00646     name = argv[Optind+1];
00647     proto = argv[Optind+2];
00648     port = (argc==Optind+4) ? atoi(argv[Optind+3]) : 0;
00649   }
00650   
00651   if( err_flag ) {
00652     fprintf(output,help_rpc_init);
00653     return -1;
00654   }
00655   
00656   /* getting the hostname */
00657   if (strlen(localmachine) == 0) {
00658     rc = gethostname( localmachine, sizeof( localmachine ) );
00659     if( rc != 0 ) {
00660       fprintf( output, "rpc_init: Error %d while getting hostname.\n", rc );
00661       return -1 ;
00662     }
00663   }
00664   
00665   rc = rpc_init(hostname, name, proto, port, output);
00666 
00667   return rc;
00668 } /* fn_rpc_init */
00669 
00670 
00671 /* nfs_remote_layer_SetLogLevel */
00672 void nfs_remote_layer_SetLogLevel( int log_lvl  ){
00673   
00674   /* Nothing to do. */
00675   return;
00676   
00677 } /* nfs_remote_layer_SetLogLevel */
00678 
00679 
00681 int fn_MNT1_remote_command( int argc ,     /* IN : number of args in argv */
00682                             char ** argv , /* IN : arg list               */
00683                             FILE * output  /* IN : output stream          */
00684                     )
00685 {
00686   cmdnfsremote_funcdesc_t * funcdesc = mnt1_remote_funcdesc;
00687   
00688   nfs_arg_t nfs_arg;
00689   nfs_res_t nfs_res;
00690   int rc;
00691   unsigned int i = 0;
00692   CLIENT * clnt;
00693       
00694   while ( funcdesc->func_name != NULL )
00695   {
00696     if ( !strcmp(  funcdesc->func_name, argv[0] ) )
00697     {
00698       do {
00699         clnt = getCLIENT("mount1");
00700         if (clnt == NULL) {
00701           fprintf(output, "MOUNT1 client not initialized\n");
00702           return -1;
00703         }
00704         
00705         /* encoding args */
00706         
00707         if ( funcdesc->func_encode( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
00708                                     argc - 1, argv + 1,
00709                                     0, NULL,
00710                                     (caddr_t)&nfs_arg ) == FALSE )
00711         {
00712           fprintf(output,"%s: bad arguments.\n",argv[0]);
00713           fprintf(output,"Usage: %s\n",funcdesc->func_help);
00714           return -1;
00715         }
00716         
00717         /* nfs call */
00718         
00719         rc = funcdesc->func_call(
00720                                     clnt,
00721                                     &nfs_arg,
00722                                     &nfs_res
00723                                  );
00724         rc = switch_result(rc, i, "mount1", argv[0], "fn_MNT1_remote_command", output);
00725         if (rc > 0) return rc;
00726         i += 1;
00727       } while (rc == -1);
00728 
00729       /* freeing args */
00730       
00731       funcdesc->func_encode( CMDNFS_FREE,
00732                              0,NULL,0,NULL,
00733                              (caddr_t)&nfs_arg );
00734 
00735       /* decoding output */
00736       
00737 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_SHELL
00738       printf("MNTv1: RETURNED STRUCTURE:\n");
00739       print_nfs_res( &nfs_res );
00740 #endif
00741       
00742       funcdesc->func_decode( CMDNFS_DECODE,
00743                              0,NULL,0,output,
00744                              (caddr_t)&nfs_res );
00745       
00746       funcdesc->func_free( &nfs_res );
00747       
00748       /* returning status */
00749       return rc;
00750       
00751     }
00752     
00753     /* pointer to the next cmdnfs_funcdesc_t */
00754     funcdesc ++ ;
00755   }
00756   
00757   fprintf(output,"%s: command not found in MNT1 protocol.\n",argv[0]);
00758   return -1;
00759 } /* fn_MNT1_remote_command */

00928 int fn_NFS3_remote_command( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00929                             char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00930                             FILE * output     /* IN : output stream          */
00931          )
00932 {
00933   cmdnfsremote_funcdesc_t * funcdesc = nfs3_remote_funcdesc;
00934   
00935   nfs_arg_t nfs_arg;
00936   nfs_res_t nfs_res;

00939   CLIENT * clnt;
00940

00942   {
00943     if ( !strcmp(  funcdesc->func_name, argv[0] ) )
00944     {
00945       do {
00946         clnt = getCLIENT("nfs3");
00947         if (clnt == NULL) {
00948           fprintf(output, "NFS3 client not initialized\n");
00949           return -1;
00950         }
00951

00953

00955                                     argc - 1, argv + 1,
00956                                     0, NULL,
00957                                     (caddr_t)&nfs_arg ) == FALSE )
00958         {
00959           fprintf(output,"%s: bad arguments.\n",argv[0]);
00960           fprintf(output,"Usage: %s\n",funcdesc->func_help);
00961           return -1;
00962         }

00965         
00966         rc = funcdesc->func_call(
00967                                     clnt,
00968                                     &nfs_arg,
00969                                     &nfs_res
00970                                  );

00979                              0,NULL,0,NULL,

00994 
00995       /* returning status */
00996       return rc;
00997       
00998     }
00999     
01000     /* pointer to the next cmdnfs_funcdesc_t */
01001     funcdesc ++ ;
01002   }
01003

01005   return -1;

01009 
01010 /*------------------------------------------------------------
01011  *     Wrapping of NFS calls (used by high level commands)
01012  *-----------------------------------------------------------*/
01013 
01014 
01015 /* solves a relative or aboslute path */
01016 int nfs_remote_solvepath(shell_fh3_t * p_mounted_path_hdl, /* IN - handle of mounted path */
01017                          char * io_global_path,            /* IN/OUT - global path */
01018                          int size_global_path,             /* IN - max size for global path */
01019                          char * i_spec_path,               /* IN - specified path */
01020                          shell_fh3_t * p_current_hdl,      /* IN - current directory handle */
01021                          shell_fh3_t * pnew_hdl,           /* OUT - pointer to solved handle */
01022                          FILE * output                     /* IN */
01023            )
01024 {
01025   char str_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
01026   char * pstr_path = str_path;
01027   
01028   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN] ;
01029   char * next_name ;
01030   char * curr ;
01031   int last=0;
01032   int rc;
01033   unsigned int i;
01034   CLIENT * clnt;
01035 
01036   shell_fh3_t hdl_lookup ;
01037   nfs_fh3 hdl_param ;
01038   
01039   diropargs3  dirop_arg;
01040   LOOKUP3res  lookup_res;
01041   
01042   strncpy(str_path, i_spec_path ,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);  
01043   curr = str_path;
01044   next_name = str_path;
01045 
01046   if (str_path[0] == '@')
01047     {
01048       
01049     rc = cmdnfs_fhandle3(
01050       CMDNFS_ENCODE, 1, &pstr_path,
01051       0,   NULL,
01052       (caddr_t)&hdl_param );
01053         
01054     if ( rc != TRUE )
01055     {
01056       fprintf( output, "Invalid FileHandle: %s\n",str_path );
01057       return -1;
01058     }
01059     
01060     strncpy( io_global_path, str_path ,size_global_path);
01061     
01062     set_shell_fh3( pnew_hdl , &hdl_param );
01063 
01064     cmdnfs_fhandle3( CMDNFS_FREE, 0, NULL, 0,   NULL,
01065                     (caddr_t)&hdl_param );    
01066     
01067     return 0;        
01068     
01069     }
01070   else if (str_path[0] == '/')
01071     {
01072       /* absolute path, starting from "/", with a relative path */
01073       curr ++;
01074       next_name ++;
01075       hdl_lookup =  *p_mounted_path_hdl ;
01076       strncpy(tmp_path, "/" ,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
01077 
01078       /* the the directory  is /, return */
01079       if (str_path[1]=='\0')
01080         {
01081           strncpy(io_global_path,tmp_path,size_global_path);
01082           *pnew_hdl = hdl_lookup ;
01083           return 0;
01084         }
01085       
01086     } 
01087   else 
01088     {
01089       hdl_lookup = *p_current_hdl ;
01090       strncpy(tmp_path, io_global_path ,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);  
01091     }
01092 
01093   /* Now, the path is a relative path, proceed a step by step lookup */
01094   do 
01095     {
01096       i = 0;
01097       /* tokenize to the next '/' */         
01098       while( ( curr[0] != '\0' ) &&  
01099              ( curr[0] != '/' ) )
01100         curr++;
01101       
01102       if (!curr[0]) 
01103         last=1; /* remembers if it was the last dir */
01104       
01105       curr[0]='\0';
01106       
01107       /* build the arguments */
01108       
01109       set_nfs_fh3( &dirop_arg.dir, &hdl_lookup);
01110       dirop_arg.name = next_name;
01111       
01112       /* lookup this name */
01113       do {
01114         clnt = getCLIENT("nfs3");
01115         if (clnt == NULL) {
01116           fprintf(output, "NFS3 client not initialized\n");
01117           return -1;
01118         }
01119         
01120         rc = nfs3_remote_Lookup(
01121                           clnt,
01122                           (nfs_arg_t*)&dirop_arg,
01123                           (nfs_res_t*)&lookup_res
01124                        );
01125         rc = switch_result(rc, i, "nfs3", "nfs3_remote_Lookup", "nfs_remote_solvepath", output);
01126         if (rc > 0) return rc;
01127         i += 1;
01128       } while (rc == -1);
01129      
01130        rc = lookup_res.status;
01131        if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01132        {
01133          nfs3_remote_Lookup_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&lookup_res );
01134          fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01135              rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01136          return rc;
01137        }
01138       
01139       /* updates current handle */
01140       set_shell_fh3( &hdl_lookup, &lookup_res.LOOKUP3res_u.resok.object ) ;
01141 
01142       nfs3_remote_Lookup_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&lookup_res );
01143          
01144       /* adds /name at the end of the path */
01145       strncat(tmp_path,"/",FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01146       strncat(tmp_path,next_name,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01147 
01148       /* updates cursors */
01149       if( !last )
01150       {
01151         curr ++;
01152         next_name = curr ;
01153         /* ignore successive slashes */
01154         while((curr[0]!='\0') && (curr[0]=='/')){
01155           curr++;
01156           next_name = curr;
01157         }
01158         if (!curr[0]) last=1; /* it is the last dir */
01159       }
01160     
01161     } while( !last );
01162     
01163   /* everything is OK, apply changes */
01164   clean_path(tmp_path,size_global_path);
01165   strncpy(io_global_path,tmp_path,size_global_path);
01166     
01167   *pnew_hdl = hdl_lookup ;
01168   return 0;
01169  
01170 } /* nfs_remote_solvepath */
01171 
01172 
01174 int nfs_remote_getattr( shell_fh3_t * p_hdl, /* IN */
01175                         fattr3 * attrs,      /* OUT */
01176                         FILE * output        /* IN */
01177            )
01178 {
01179   GETATTR3res res;
01180   int rc;
01181   unsigned int i = 0;
01182   CLIENT * clnt;
01183   
01184   nfs_fh3 nfshdl;
01185   
01186   set_nfs_fh3( &nfshdl , p_hdl );
01187   
01188   do {
01189     clnt = getCLIENT("nfs3");
01190     if (clnt == NULL) {
01191       fprintf(output, "NFS3 client not initialized\n");
01192       return -1;
01193     }
01194     
01195     rc = nfs3_remote_Getattr(
01196                       clnt,
01197                       (nfs_arg_t*)&nfshdl,
01198                       (nfs_res_t*)&res
01199                    );
01200     rc = switch_result(rc, i, "nfs3", "nfs3_remote_Getattr", "nfs_remote_getattr", output);
01201     if (rc > 0) return rc;
01202     i += 1;
01203   } while (rc == -1);
01204 
01205   rc = res.status;
01206   if ( rc != NFS3_OK ) {
01207     fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01208        rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01209    
01210     nfs3_remote_Getattr_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01211     return rc;
01212   }
01213 
01214   /* updates current handle */
01215   *attrs = res.GETATTR3res_u.resok.obj_attributes;
01216 
01217   nfs3_remote_Getattr_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01218   
01219   return 0;
01220 } /* nfs_remote_getattr */
01221 
01222 
01224 int nfs_remote_access( shell_fh3_t * p_hdl,       /* IN */
01225                        nfs3_uint32 * access_mask, /* IN/OUT */
01226                        FILE * output              /* IN */
01227            )
01228 {
01229   ACCESS3args arg;
01230   ACCESS3res  res ;
01231   int rc;
01232   unsigned int i = 0;
01233   CLIENT * clnt;
01234   
01235   /* preparing args */
01236   set_nfs_fh3( &arg.object, p_hdl);
01237   arg.access = *access_mask;
01238   
01239   do {
01240     clnt = getCLIENT("nfs3");
01241     if (clnt == NULL) {
01242       fprintf(output, "NFS3 client not initialized\n");
01243       return -1;
01244     }
01245     
01246     rc = nfs3_remote_Access(
01247                       clnt,
01248                       (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01249                       (nfs_res_t*)&res
01250                    );
01251     rc = switch_result(rc, i, "nfs3", "nfs3_remote_Access", "nfs_remote_access", output);
01252     if (rc > 0) return rc;
01253     i += 1;
01254   } while (rc == -1);
01255 
01256   rc = res.status;
01257   if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01258   {
01259     fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01260         rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01261     nfs3_remote_Access_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01262     return rc;
01263   }
01264 
01265   /* updates access mask */
01266   *access_mask = res.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access;
01267 
01268   nfs3_remote_Access_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01269   
01270   return 0;
01271   
01272 } /* nfs_remote_access */
01273     
01274 
01276 int nfs_remote_readlink( shell_fh3_t * p_hdl, /* IN */
01277                          char * linkcontent,  /* OUT */
01278                          FILE * output        /* IN */
01279            )
01280 {
01281   READLINK3res res;
01282   int rc;
01283   unsigned int i = 0;
01284   CLIENT * clnt;
01285   
01286   nfs_fh3 nfshdl;
01287   
01288   set_nfs_fh3( &nfshdl, p_hdl );
01289 
01290   do {
01291     clnt = getCLIENT("nfs3");
01292     if (clnt == NULL) {
01293       fprintf(output, "NFS3 client not initialized\n");
01294       return -1;
01295     }
01296     
01297     rc = nfs3_remote_Readlink(
01298                       clnt,
01299                       (nfs_arg_t*)&nfshdl,
01300                       (nfs_res_t*)&res
01301                    );
01302     rc = switch_result(rc, i, "nfs3", "nfs3_remote_Readlink", "nfs_remote_readlink", output);
01303     if (rc > 0) return rc;
01304     i += 1;
01305   } while (rc == -1);
01306 
01307   rc = res.status;
01308   if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01309   {
01310     fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01311         rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01312     nfs3_remote_Readlink_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01313     return rc;
01314   }
01315 
01316   /* copy link content */
01317   strcpy( linkcontent, res.READLINK3res_u.resok.data );
01318   
01319   nfs3_remote_Readlink_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01320   
01321   return 0;
01322   
01323 } /* nfs_remote_readlink */
01324 
01325 
01327 int nfs_remote_readdirplus( shell_fh3_t * p_dir_hdl,    /* IN */
01328                             cookie3 cookie,             /* IN */ 
01329                             cookieverf3 * p_cookieverf, /* IN/OUT */
01330                             dirlistplus3 * dirlist,     /* OUT */
01331                             nfs_res_t ** to_be_freed,   /* OUT */
01332                             FILE * output               /* IN */
01333            )
01334 {
01335   READDIRPLUS3args arg;
01336   READDIRPLUS3res * p_res;
01337   int rc;
01338   unsigned int i = 0;
01339   CLIENT * clnt;
01340 
01341   *to_be_freed = NULL;
01342     
01343   /* args */
01344   set_nfs_fh3( &arg.dir, p_dir_hdl );
01345   arg.cookie = cookie;
01346   memcpy ( &arg.cookieverf, p_cookieverf, sizeof( cookieverf3 ) );
01347   arg.dircount = 1024;
01348   arg.maxcount = 4096;
01349   
01350   p_res = ( READDIRPLUS3res * ) Mem_Alloc( sizeof( READDIRPLUS3res ) );
01351 
01352   do {
01353     clnt = getCLIENT("nfs3");
01354     if (clnt == NULL) {
01355       fprintf(output, "NFS3 client not initialized\n");
01356       return -1;
01357     }
01358       
01359     rc = nfs3_remote_Readdirplus(
01360                       clnt,
01361                       (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01362                       (nfs_res_t*)p_res
01363                    );
01364     rc = switch_result(rc, i, "nfs3", "nfs3_remote_Readdirplus", "nfs_remote_readdirplus", output);
01365     if (rc > 0) return rc;
01366     i += 1;
01367   } while (rc == -1);
01368 
01369   rc = p_res->status;
01370   if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01371   {
01372     nfs3_remote_Readdirplus_Free( (nfs_res_t*)p_res );
01373     Mem_Free( p_res );
01374     fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01375         rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01376     return rc;
01377   }
01378  
01379   memcpy( p_cookieverf, p_res->READDIRPLUS3res_u.resok.cookieverf,
01380       sizeof( cookieverf3 ) );
01381   
01382   *dirlist = p_res->READDIRPLUS3res_u.resok.reply;
01383   *to_be_freed = (nfs_res_t*)p_res;
01384   
01385   return 0;
01386 } /* nfs_remote_readdirplus */
01387 
01388 
01390 void nfs_remote_readdirplus_free( nfs_res_t * to_free )
01391 {
01392   if ( to_free == NULL ) return;
01393   
01394   nfs3_remote_Readdirplus_Free( (nfs_res_t*)to_free );
01395   Mem_Free( to_free );  
01396 } /* nfs_remote_readdirplus_free */

01421

01423

01425     clnt = getCLIENT("nfs3");

01427       fprintf(output, "NFS3 client not initialized\n");
01428       return -1;
01429     }

01432                       clnt,
01433                       (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01434                       (nfs_res_t*)p_res
01435                    );
01436     rc = switch_result(rc, i, "nfs3", "nfs3_remote_Readdir", "nfs_remote_readdir", output);
01437     if (rc > 0) return rc;
01438     i += 1;
01439   } while (rc == -1);
01440 
01441   rc = p_res->status;
01442   if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01443   {
01444     nfs3_remote_Readdir_Free( (nfs_res_t*)p_res );
01445     Mem_Free( p_res );
01446     fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01447         rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01448     return rc;
01449   }
01450  
01451   memcpy( p_cookieverf, p_res->READDIR3res_u.resok.cookieverf,
01452       sizeof( cookieverf3 ) );
01453   
01454   *dirlist = p_res->READDIR3res_u.resok.reply;
01455   *to_be_freed = (nfs_res_t*)p_res;
01456   
01457   return 0;
01458 } /* nfs_remote_readdirplus */

01470 
01472 int nfs_remote_create( shell_fh3_t * p_dir_hdl, /* IN */ 
01473                        char * obj_name,         /* IN */
01474                        mode_t posix_mode,       /* IN */
01475                        shell_fh3_t * p_obj_hdl, /* OUT */
01476                        FILE * output            /* IN */
01477            )
01478 {
01479   CREATE3args arg;
01480   CREATE3res res;
01481   int rc;
01482   unsigned int i = 0;
01483   CLIENT * clnt;   
01484       
01485   /* preparing arguments */
01486   
01487   set_nfs_fh3( &arg.where.dir, p_dir_hdl );  
01488   arg.where.name = obj_name;
01489   arg.how.mode = GUARDED;
01490 
01491   /* empty sattr3 list */
01492   if ( cmdnfs_sattr3( CMDNFS_ENCODE, 0, NULL, 0, NULL,
01493                  (caddr_t)&(arg.how.createhow3_u.obj_attributes) ) == FALSE )
01494   {
01495     /* invalid handle */
01496     fprintf( output, "\tError encoding nfs arguments.\n" );
01497     return -1 ;
01498   }
01499   
01500   /* only setting mode */
01501   arg.how.createhow3_u.obj_attributes.mode.set_it = TRUE;
01502   arg.how.createhow3_u.obj_attributes.mode.set_mode3_u.mode = posix_mode;
01503   
01504   do {
01505     clnt = getCLIENT("nfs3");
01506     if (clnt == NULL) {
01507       fprintf(output, "NFS3 client not initialized\n");
01508       return -1;
01509     }
01510     
01511     rc = nfs3_remote_Create(
01512                       clnt,
01513                       (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01514                       (nfs_res_t*)&res
01515                    );
01516     rc = switch_result(rc, i, "nfs3", "nfs3_remote_Create", "nfs_remote_create", output);
01517     if (rc > 0) return rc;
01518     i += 1;
01519   } while (rc == -1);
01520 
01521   rc = res.status;
01522   if ( rc != NFS3_OK ) {
01523     fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01524         rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01525     nfs3_remote_Create_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01526     return rc;
01527   }
01528 
01529   /* object handle */
01530   if ( res.CREATE3res_u.resok.obj.handle_follows )
01531     set_shell_fh3( p_obj_hdl, &res.CREATE3res_u.resok.obj.post_op_fh3_u.handle );
01532   else {
01533     fprintf(output,"Warning: nfs3_remote_Create did not return file handle.\n");
01534     nfs3_remote_Create_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01535     return -1;
01536   }
01537     
01538   nfs3_remote_Create_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01539    
01540   return 0;
01541   
01542 } /* nfs_remote_create */
01543

01546 int nfs_remote_mkdir( shell_fh3_t * p_dir_hdl, /* IN */
01547                       char * obj_name,         /* IN */
01548                       mode_t posix_mode,       /* IN */
01549                       shell_fh3_t * p_obj_hdl, /* OUT */
01550                       FILE * output            /* IN */
01551            )
01552 {

01554   MKDIR3res res;

01560

01562   arg.where.name = obj_name;
01563 
01564   /* empty sattr3 list */
01565   if ( cmdnfs_sattr3( CMDNFS_ENCODE, 0, NULL, 0, NULL,
01566                  (caddr_t)&(arg.attributes) ) == FALSE )
01567   {
01568     /* invalid handle */
01569     fprintf( output, "\tError encoding nfs arguments.\n" );
01570     return -1 ;
01571   }
01572   
01573   /* only setting mode */
01574   arg.attributes.mode.set_it = TRUE;
01575   arg.attributes.mode.set_mode3_u.mode = posix_mode;
01576   
01577   do {
01578     clnt = getCLIENT("nfs3");
01579     if (clnt == NULL) {
01580       fprintf(output, "NFS3 client not initialized\n");
01581       return -1;
01582     }
01583     
01584     rc = nfs3_remote_Mkdir(
01585                       clnt,
01586                       (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01587                       (nfs_res_t*)&res
01588                    );
01589     rc = switch_result(rc, i, "nfs3", "nfs3_remote_Mkdir", "nfs_remote_mkdir", output);
01590     if (rc > 0) return rc;
01591     i += 1;
01592   } while (rc == -1);
01593 
01594   rc = res.status;
01595   if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01596   {
01597     fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01598         rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01599     nfs3_remote_Mkdir_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01600     return rc;
01601   }
01602 
01603   /* object handle */
01604   if ( res.MKDIR3res_u.resok.obj.handle_follows )
01605     set_shell_fh3( p_obj_hdl, &res.MKDIR3res_u.resok.obj.post_op_fh3_u.handle ) ;
01606   else {
01607     fprintf(output,"Warning: nfs3_remote_Mkdir did not return file handle.\n");
01608     nfs3_remote_Mkdir_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );   
01609     return -1;
01610   }
01611 
01612   nfs3_remote_Mkdir_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );   
01613    
01614   return 0;
01615 } /*nfs_remote_mkdir*/
