01869 
01871 int nfs_remote_symlink( shell_fh3_t path_hdl,     /* IN */ 
01872                         char * link_name,         /* IN */
01873                         char * link_content,      /* IN */ 
01874                         sattr3 * p_setattr,       /* IN */
01875                         shell_fh3_t * p_link_hdl, /* OUT */
01876                         FILE * output             /* IN */
01877            )
01878 {
01879   SYMLINK3args arg;
01880   SYMLINK3res res;
01881   int rc;
01882   unsigned int i = 0;
01883   CLIENT * clnt;
01884   
01885   /* preparing arguments */
01886   
01887   set_nfs_fh3( &arg.where.dir, &path_hdl );
01888   arg.where.name = link_name;
01889   arg.symlink.symlink_attributes = *p_setattr;
01890   arg.symlink.symlink_data = link_content;
01891 
01892   do {
01893     clnt = getCLIENT("nfs3");
01894     if (clnt == NULL) {
01895       fprintf(output, "NFS3 client not initialized\n");
01896       return -1;
01897     }
01898     
01899     rc = nfs3_remote_Symlink(
01900                       clnt,
01901                       (nfs_arg_t*)&arg,
01902                       (nfs_res_t*)&res
01903                   );
01904     rc = switch_result(rc, i, "nfs3", "nfs3_remote_Symlink", "nfs_remote_symlink", output);
01905     if (rc > 0) return rc;
01906     i += 1;
01907   } while (rc == -1);
01908 
01909   rc = res.status;
01910   if ( rc != NFS3_OK )
01911   {
01912     fprintf(output, "Error %d in NFSv3 protocol: %s\n",
01913         rc,nfsstat3_to_str(rc));
01914     /* free nfs call resources */
01915     nfs3_remote_Symlink_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01916     return rc;
01917   }
01918 
01919   /* returned handle */
01920   if ( res.SYMLINK3res_u.resok.obj.handle_follows ) {
01921     set_shell_fh3( p_link_hdl , &res.SYMLINK3res_u.resok.obj.post_op_fh3_u.handle ) ;
01922   } else {
01923     fprintf(output,"Warning: nfs3_remote_Symlink did not return file handle.\n");
01924     nfs3_remote_Symlink_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01925     return -1;
01926   }
01927   
01928   /* free nfs call resources */
01929   nfs3_remote_Symlink_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01930   
01931   return 0;
01932   
01933 } /*nfs_remote_symlink*/
01934 
01935 
01937 int nfs_remote_mount( char * str_path,         /* IN */
01938                       shell_fh3_t * p_mnt_hdl, /* OUT */
01939                       FILE * output            /* IN */
01940     )
01941 {
01942   int rc;
01943   unsigned int i = 0;
01944   nfs_arg_t nfs_arg;
01945   mountres3 res;
01946   CLIENT * clnt;
01947 
01948   rc = cmdnfs_dirpath( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
01949                        1, &str_path,
01950                        0, NULL,
01951                        (caddr_t)&nfs_arg );
01952   if (rc == FALSE) {
01953     fprintf(output, "nfs_remote_mount : Error during encoding args\n");
01954     return -1;
01955   }
01956   
01957   do {
01958     clnt = getCLIENT("mount3");
01959     if (clnt == NULL) {
01960       fprintf(output, "MOUNT3 client not initialized\n");
01961       return -1;
01962     }
01963       
01964     /* nfs call */
01965 
01966     rc = mnt3_remote_Mnt(
01967                     clnt,
01968                     &nfs_arg,
01969                     (nfs_res_t*)&res
01970                  );
01971     rc = switch_result(rc, i, "mount3", "mnt3_remote_Mnt", "nfs_remote_mount", output);
01972     if (rc > 0) return rc;
01973     i += 1;
01974   } while (rc == -1);
01975 
01976   cmdnfs_dirpath( CMDNFS_FREE,
01977                    0,NULL,0,NULL,
01978                    (caddr_t)&nfs_arg );
01979   
01980   rc = res.fhs_status;
01981   if ( rc != MNT3_OK )
01982   {
01983     mnt3_remote_Mnt_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01984     fprintf(output, "nfs_remote_mount: Error %d in MNT3 protocol.\n",rc);
01985     return rc;
01986   }
01987 
01988   set_shell_fh3( p_mnt_hdl , (nfs_fh3*)&res.mountres3_u.mountinfo.fhandle ) ;
01989   
01990   mnt3_remote_Mnt_Free( (nfs_res_t*)&res );
01991    
01992   return 0;
01993 } /* nfs_remote_mount */
01994 
01995 /*------------------------------------------------------------
01996  *          High level, shell-like commands 
01997  *-----------------------------------------------------------*/
01998 
02000 int fn_nfs_remote_mount( int argc ,          /* IN : number of args in argv */
02001                   char ** argv ,      /* IN : arg list               */
02002                   FILE * output   )   /* IN : output stream          */
02003 {
02004   int rc;
02005   char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
02006   shell_fh3_t mnt_hdl;
02007 
02008   /* check if a path has already been mounted */
02009   
02010   if ( is_mounted_path != FALSE )
02011   {
02012     fprintf( output, "%s: a path is already mounted. Use \"umount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02013     return -1 ;
02014   }
02015 
02016   if (argc - 1 != 1) {
02017     fprintf(output,"%s: bad arguments.\n",argv[0]);
02018     fprintf(output,"Usage: mount <path>.\n");
02019     return -1;
02020   }
02021 
02022   rc = nfs_remote_mount(argv[1], &mnt_hdl, output);
02023   if (rc != 0) return -1;
02024    
02025   memcpy( &mounted_path_hdl, &mnt_hdl, sizeof(shell_fh3_t));
02026    
02027   strcpy( mounted_path , argv[1] );
02028       
02029   current_path_hdl = mounted_path_hdl;
02030   strcpy( current_path , "/" );
02031    
02032   is_mounted_path = TRUE;
02033    
02034   fprintf( output, "Current directory is \"%s\" \n", current_path );
02035   snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,
02036       (caddr_t)current_path_hdl.data_val ,
02037       current_path_hdl.data_len );
02038   fprintf( output, "Current File handle is \"@%s\" \n", buff ); 
02039   
02040   return 0;
02041 }
02042 
02043 
02044 
02046 int fn_nfs_remote_umount( int argc ,          /* IN : number of args in argv */
02047                   char ** argv ,      /* IN : arg list               */
02048                   FILE * output   )   /* IN : output stream          */
02049 {
02050   int rc;
02051   unsigned int i = 0;
02052   nfs_arg_t nfs_arg;
02053   nfs_res_t res;
02054   CLIENT * clnt;
02055 
02056   /* check if a path has already been mounted */
02057   
02058   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02059   {
02060     fprintf( output, "%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02061     return -1 ;
02062   }
02063   
02064       
02065   if ( cmdnfs_dirpath( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
02066                        argc - 1, argv + 1,
02067                        0, NULL,
02068                        (caddr_t)&nfs_arg ) == FALSE )
02069   {
02070     fprintf(output,"%s: bad arguments.\n",argv[0]);
02071     fprintf(output,"Usage: umount <path>.\n");
02072     return -1;
02073   }
02074 
02075   if (strncmp(argv[1], mounted_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN)) {
02076     fprintf(output, "%s: this path is not mounted.\n", argv[0]);
02077     fprintf(output, "Current monted path : %s.\n", mounted_path);
02078     return -1;
02079   }
02080 
02081   do {
02082     clnt = getCLIENT("mount3");
02083     if (clnt == NULL) {
02084       fprintf(output, "MOUNT3 client not initialized\n");
02085       return -1;
02086     }
02087       
02088     /* nfs call */
02089 
02090     rc = mnt3_remote_Mnt(
02091                     clnt,
02092                     &nfs_arg,
02093                     (nfs_res_t*)&res
02094                  );
02095     rc = switch_result(rc, i, "mount3", "mnt3_remote_Umnt", "fn_nfs_remote_umount", output);
02096     if (rc > 0) return rc;
02097     i += 1;
02098   } while (rc == -1);
02099 
02100   /* freeing args */
02101       
02102   cmdnfs_dirpath( CMDNFS_FREE,
02103                   0,NULL,0,NULL,
02104                   (caddr_t)&nfs_arg );
02105   
02106   if ( rc != 0 )
02107   {
02108     fprintf(output,"%s: Error %d in mnt_Umnt.\n",argv[0],rc);
02109      return rc;
02110   }
02111    
02112   mnt3_remote_Umnt_Free( &res );
02113 
02114   is_mounted_path = FALSE;
02115    
02116   return 0;
02117 }
02118 
02119 
02120 
02122 int fn_nfs_remote_pwd( int argc ,          /* IN : number of args in argv */
02123                 char ** argv ,      /* IN : arg list               */
02124                 FILE * output   )   /* IN : output stream          */
02125 {
02126   char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
02127   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02128   {
02129     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02130     return -1 ;
02131   }
02132   
02133   fprintf( output, "Current directory is \"%s\" \n", current_path ) ;
02134   snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,
02135       (caddr_t)current_path_hdl.data_val ,
02136       current_path_hdl.data_len ) ;
02137   fprintf( output, "Current File handle is \"@%s\" \n", buff ); 
02138   
02139   return 0;  
02140 }
02141 
02142 
02144 int  fn_nfs_remote_ls( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02145                 char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02146                 FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
02147 {
02148 #define NFS_READDIR_SIZE 10
02149   
02150   char linkdata[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02151   char item_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02152   char * str_name = "." ;
02153   shell_fh3_t handle_tmp;
02154   fattr3 attrs;
02155   cookie3 begin_cookie;
02156   bool_t  eod_met;
02157   cookieverf3 cookieverf;
02158   dirlistplus3 dirlist;
02159   entryplus3 * p_entry;
02160   
02161   fattr3 * p_attrs;
02162   shell_fh3_t hdl;
02163   shell_fh3_t * p_hdl = NULL;
02164 
02165   nfs_res_t * to_free = NULL;
02166       
02167   int rc = 0 ;
02168   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02169 
02170   static char format[]="hvdlSHz";
02171   static char help_ls[]="usage: ls [options] [name|path]\n"
02172     "options :\n"
02173     "\t-h print this help\n"
02174     "\t-v verbose mode\n"
02175     "\t-d print directory info instead of listing its content\n"      
02176     "\t-l print standard UNIX attributes\n"
02177     "\t-S print all supported attributes\n"
02178     "\t-H print the NFS handle\n" 
02179     "\t-z silent mode (print nothing)\n" ;
02180   
02181   int option;
02182   int flag_v = 0;
02183   int flag_h = 0;
02184   int flag_d = 0;
02185   int flag_l = 0;
02186   int flag_S = 0;
02187   int flag_H = 0 ;
02188   int flag_z = 0 ;
02189   int err_flag = 0;
02190 
02191   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02192   
02193   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02194   {
02195     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02196     return -1 ;
02197   }
02198   
02199     
02200   /* analysing options */
02201   getopt_init();
02202 
02203   while ( (option = Getopt(argc, argv, format) ) != -1)
02204     {   
02205       switch( option )
02206         {
02207         case 'v':
02208           if (flag_v)
02209             fprintf(output,
02210                     "ls: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02211           else 
02212             flag_v++;
02213           break;
02214           
02215         case 'h':
02216           if ( flag_h )
02217             fprintf(output,
02218                     "ls: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02219           else 
02220             flag_h++;
02221           break;
02222           
02223         case 'd':
02224           if ( flag_d )
02225             fprintf(output,
02226                     "ls: warning: option 'd' has been specified more than once.\n");
02227           else 
02228             flag_d++;
02229           break;
02230           
02231         case 'l':
02232           if ( flag_l )
02233             fprintf(output,
02234                     "ls: warning: option 'l' has been specified more than once.\n");
02235           else 
02236             flag_l++;
02237           break;
02238           
02239         case 'S':
02240           if ( flag_S )
02241             fprintf(output,
02242                     "ls: warning: option 'S' has been specified more than once.\n");
02243           else 
02244             flag_S++;
02245           break;
02246           
02247         case 'z':
02248           if ( flag_z )
02249             fprintf(output,
02250                     "ls: warning: option 'z' has been specified more than once.\n");
02251           else 
02252             flag_z++;
02253           break;
02254 
02255         case 'H':
02256           if( flag_H )
02257             fprintf(output,
02258                     "ls: warning: option 'H' has been specified more than once.\n");
02259           else 
02260             flag_H++;
02261           break;
02262           
02263         case '?':
02264           fprintf(output,"ls: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02265           err_flag ++;
02266           break;
02267         }
02268     } /* while */
02269   
02270   if( flag_l + flag_S + flag_H > 1 )
02271     {
02272       fprintf(output,"ls: conflict between options l,S,H\n");
02273       err_flag++;
02274     }
02275 
02276   if( flag_z + flag_v > 1 )
02277     {
02278       fprintf( output, "ls: can't use -z and -v at the same time\n" ) ;
02279       err_flag ++ ;
02280     }
02281   
02282   if( flag_h )
02283     {
02284       fprintf(output,help_ls);
02285       return 0;
02286     }
02287   
02288   if( err_flag )
02289     {
02290       fprintf(output,help_ls);
02291       return -1;
02292     }
02293   
02294   /* copy current global path */
02295   strncpy(glob_path,current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
02296 
02297   /* first, retrieve the argument (if any) */
02298   if( Optind == argc -1  )
02299     { 
02300       str_name = argv[Optind];
02301       
02302       /* retrieving handle */  
02303       if (rc = nfs_remote_solvepath( &mounted_path_hdl,
02304                                     glob_path,
02305                                     NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
02306                                     str_name, 
02307                                     &current_path_hdl, 
02308                                     &handle_tmp,
02309                                     output))
02310         return rc;
02311     } 
02312   else 
02313     {
02314       str_name = ".";
02315       handle_tmp = current_path_hdl ;
02316     }
02317   
02318   if( flag_v )
02319     fprintf(output,"proceeding ls (using NFS protocol) on \"%s\"\n", glob_path );
02320   
02321   if ( rc = nfs_remote_getattr( &handle_tmp, &attrs, output ) ) return rc;
02322   
02323  /*
02324   * if the object is a file or a directoy with the -d option specified,
02325   * we only show its info and exit.
02326   */  
02327   if ( ( attrs.type != NF3DIR ) || flag_d )
02328     {
02329       if ( (attrs.type == NF3LNK) && flag_l )
02330         {
02331             if ( rc = nfs_remote_readlink( &handle_tmp, linkdata, output ) )
02332               return rc;
02333         }
02334       
02335       if( flag_l )
02336         {
02337           if( !flag_z )
02338             print_nfsitem_line( output, &attrs, str_name, linkdata );
02339         }
02340       else if( flag_S )
02341         {
02342           if( !flag_z )
02343             {
02344               fprintf(output,"%s :\n",str_name);
02345               print_nfs_attributes( &attrs, output );
02346             }
02347         } 
02348       else if( flag_H )
02349         {
02350           if( !flag_z )
02351             {
02352               char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1] ;
02353               
02354               snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1, (caddr_t)handle_tmp.data_val ,
02355                           handle_tmp.data_len ) ;
02356               fprintf( output, "%s (@%s)\n", str_name, buff ) ;
02357             }
02358         }
02359       else  /* only prints the name */
02360         {
02361           if( !flag_z )
02362             fprintf(output,"%s\n",str_name);
02363         }
02364         
02365       return 0;
02366     }
02367   
02368   /* If this point is reached, then the current element is a directory */
02369   
02370   begin_cookie = 0LL ;
02371   eod_met = FALSE ;
02372   memset( &cookieverf, 0, sizeof(cookieverf3) );
02373   
02374   while( ! eod_met )
02375     {
02376       
02377       if( flag_v )
02378          fprintf( output, "-->nfs3_remote_Readdirplus( path=%s, cookie=%llu )\n",
02379                   glob_path,
02380                   begin_cookie ) ;
02381 
02382       if ( rc = nfs_remote_readdirplus( &handle_tmp,
02383                                         begin_cookie,
02384                                         &cookieverf, /* IN/OUT */
02385                                         &dirlist,
02386                                         &to_free,
02387                                         output ) )
02388         return rc;
02389 
02390       p_entry = dirlist.entries;
02391       
02392       
02393       while ( p_entry )
02394         {
02395           if (!strcmp(str_name,"."))
02396             strncpy(item_path,p_entry->name,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);          
02397           else if (str_name[strlen(str_name)-1] == '/')
02398             snprintf(item_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,"%s%s",str_name,p_entry->name);
02399           else
02400             snprintf(item_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,"%s/%s",str_name,p_entry->name);
02401           
02402           /* interpreting post-op attributes */
02403           
02404           if ( p_entry->name_attributes.attributes_follow )
02405             p_attrs = &p_entry->name_attributes.post_op_attr_u.attributes;
02406           else
02407             p_attrs = NULL;
02408 
02409           /* interpreting post-op handle */
02410           
02411           if ( p_entry->name_handle.handle_follows )
02412           {
02413             set_shell_fh3( &hdl, &p_entry->name_handle.post_op_fh3_u.handle );
02414             p_hdl = &hdl;
02415           }
02416           else
02417             p_hdl = NULL;
02418 
02419 
02420           if( (p_attrs != NULL)
02421                 && (p_hdl != NULL)
02422                 && (p_attrs->type == NF3LNK ) )
02423             {
02424               if ( rc = nfs_remote_readlink( p_hdl, linkdata, output ))
02425                 return rc;
02426             }
02427           
02428           if( (p_attrs != NULL) && flag_l )
02429             {
02430               print_nfsitem_line( output, p_attrs, item_path, linkdata);
02431             }
02432           else if( (p_attrs != NULL) && flag_S )
02433             {
02434               fprintf(output,"%s :\n",item_path);
02435               if( !flag_z )
02436                 print_nfs_attributes( p_attrs, output);
02437             }
02438           else if( (p_hdl != NULL) && flag_H )
02439             {
02440               if( !flag_z )
02441                 {
02442                   char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1] ;
02443 
02444                   snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1, (caddr_t)p_hdl->data_val ,
02445                               p_hdl->data_len ) ;
02446                   fprintf( output, "%s (@%s)\n", item_path, buff ) ;                  
02447                 }
02448             }
02449           else
02450             {
02451               if( !flag_z )
02452                 fprintf(output,"%s\n",item_path);
02453             }
02454             
02455           begin_cookie = p_entry->cookie ;
02456           p_entry = p_entry->nextentry;
02457         }
02458         
02459       /* Ready for next iteration */
02460       eod_met = dirlist.eof;
02461       
02462     }
02463   
02464   nfs_remote_readdirplus_free( to_free );
02465 
02466   return 0;
02467 } /* fn_nfs_remote_ls */
02468 
02469 
02470 
02472 int fn_nfs_remote_cd( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02473         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02474         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02475       ){
02476 
02477   
02478   static char help_cd[]=
02479   "usage: cd <path>\n";
02480 
02481   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02482   shell_fh3_t new_hdl;
02483   int rc;
02484   fattr3 attrs;
02485   nfs3_uint32 mask;
02486     
02487   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02488   
02489   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02490   {
02491     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02492     return -1 ;
02493   }
02494   
02495   /* Exactly one arg expected */
02496   if (argc!=2){
02497     fprintf(output,help_cd);
02498     return -1;
02499   }
02500   
02501   strncpy(glob_path, current_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
02502   
02503   if (rc = 
02504       nfs_remote_solvepath( &mounted_path_hdl, glob_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
02505                      argv[1],&current_path_hdl,&new_hdl,output))
02506     return rc;
02507 
02508   /* verify if the object is a directory */
02509   
02510   if ( rc = nfs_remote_getattr( &new_hdl, &attrs, output ) ) return rc;
02511   
02512   if (attrs.type != NF3DIR)
02513   {
02514     fprintf(output,"Error: %s is not a directory\n",glob_path);
02515     return ENOTDIR;
02516   }
02517   
02518   /* verify lookup permission  */  
02519   mask = ACCESS3_LOOKUP;
02520   if ( rc = nfs_remote_access( &new_hdl, &mask, output ) ) return rc;
02521   
02522   if ( ! ( mask & ACCESS3_LOOKUP ) )
02523   {
02524     fprintf(output,"Error: %s: permission denied.\n",glob_path);
02525     return EACCES;
02526   }
02527   
02528   /* if so, apply changes */
02529   strncpy( current_path, glob_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );   
02530   current_path_hdl = new_hdl;
02531     
02532   {
02533     char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
02534     fprintf( output, "Current directory is \"%s\" \n", current_path ) ;
02535     snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,
02536         (caddr_t)current_path_hdl.data_val ,
02537         current_path_hdl.data_len ) ;
02538     fprintf( output, "Current File handle is \"@%s\" \n", buff ); 
02539   }
02540   
02541   return 0;
02542       
02543 }
02544 
02545 
02546 
02548 int fn_nfs_remote_create(
02549                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02550                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02551                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02552                   )
02553 {
02554   static char format[]="hv";
02555    
02556   static char help_create[]=
02557   "usage: create [-h][-v] <path> <mode>\n"
02558   "       path: path of the file to be created\n"
02559   "       mode: octal mode for the directory to be created (ex: 644)\n" ;
02560 
02561   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02562   shell_fh3_t new_hdl ;
02563   shell_fh3_t subdir_hdl ;
02564   int rc,option;
02565   int flag_v=0;
02566   int flag_h=0;
02567   int err_flag=0;
02568   int mode=0644;
02569   
02570   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02571   char * path;
02572   char * file;
02573   char * strmode;
02574   
02575   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02576   
02577   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02578   {
02579     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02580     return -1 ;
02581   }
02582   
02583   /* analysing options */
02584   getopt_init();
02585   while ( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1){   
02586     switch( option )
02587       {
02588       case 'v':
02589         if( flag_v )
02590           fprintf( output, "create: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02591         else flag_v++;
02592         break;
02593         
02594       case 'h':
02595         if( flag_h )
02596           fprintf( output, "create: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02597         else flag_h++;
02598         break;
02599         
02600       case '?':
02601         fprintf( output,"create: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
02602         err_flag ++;
02603         break;
02604     }    
02605   }
02606   
02607   if( flag_h )
02608     {
02609       fprintf( output, help_create);
02610       return 0;
02611     }
02612   
02613   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02614   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) ) {
02615       err_flag ++;
02616   } else {
02617     strncpy( tmp_path, argv[Optind], NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02618     split_path( tmp_path, &path, &file);
02619     
02620     strmode = argv[Optind+1];
02621   
02622     /* converting mode string to posix mode */
02623     mode = atomode( strmode );
02624     if( mode<0 ) err_flag ++;
02625   }
02626     
02627   if( err_flag ) {
02628     fprintf( output, help_create );
02629     return -1;
02630   }
02631   
02632   /* copy current path. */
02633   strncpy( glob_path, current_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02634   
02635   /* retrieves path handle*/
02636   if (rc = nfs_remote_solvepath( &mounted_path_hdl, glob_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
02637                           path, &current_path_hdl, &subdir_hdl,output) )
02638     return rc;
02639 
02640   
02641   if ( rc = nfs_remote_create( &subdir_hdl, file, mode, &new_hdl,output))
02642     return rc;
02643 
02644   if( flag_v ) {
02645     char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
02646     snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,(caddr_t)new_hdl.data_val ,
02647                 new_hdl.data_len ) ;
02648     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully created.\n(handle=@%s)\n",glob_path,file, buff ) ;
02649   }
02650 
02651   return 0;  
02652 }
02653 
02654 
02655 
02657 int fn_nfs_remote_mkdir(
02658                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02659                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02660                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02661                   )
02662 {
02663   static char format[]="hv";
02664    
02665   static char help_mkdir[]=
02666   "usage: mkdir [-h][-v] <path> <mode>\n"
02667   "       path: path of the directory to be created\n"
02668   "       mode: octal mode for the dir to be created (ex: 755)\n" ;
02669 
02670   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02671   shell_fh3_t new_hdl ;
02672   shell_fh3_t subdir_hdl ;
02673   int rc,option;
02674   int flag_v=0;
02675   int flag_h=0;
02676   int err_flag=0;
02677   int mode=0755;
02678   
02679   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02680   char * path;
02681   char * file;
02682   char * strmode;
02683   
02684   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02685   
02686   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02687   {
02688     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02689     return -1 ;
02690   }
02691   
02692   /* analysing options */
02693   getopt_init();
02694   while ( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1){   
02695     switch( option )
02696       {
02697       case 'v':
02698         if( flag_v )
02699           fprintf( output, "mkdir: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02700         else flag_v++;
02701         break;
02702         
02703       case 'h':
02704         if( flag_h )
02705           fprintf( output, "mkdir: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02706         else flag_h++;
02707         break;
02708         
02709       case '?':
02710         fprintf( output,"mkdir: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
02711         err_flag ++;
02712         break;
02713     }    
02714   }
02715   
02716   if( flag_h )
02717     {
02718       fprintf( output, help_mkdir);
02719       return 0;
02720     }
02721   
02722   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02723   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) ) {
02724     err_flag ++;
02725   } else {
02726     strncpy( tmp_path, argv[Optind], NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02727     split_path( tmp_path, &path, &file);
02728       
02729     strmode = argv[Optind+1];
02730   
02731     /* converting mode string to posix mode */
02732     mode = atomode( strmode );
02733     if( mode<0 ) err_flag ++;
02734   }
02735     
02736   if( err_flag ) {
02737     fprintf( output, help_mkdir );
02738     return -1;
02739   }
02740   
02741   /* copy current path. */
02742   strncpy( glob_path, current_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02743   
02744   /* retrieves path handle*/
02745   if (rc = nfs_remote_solvepath( &mounted_path_hdl, glob_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
02746                           path, &current_path_hdl, &subdir_hdl,output) )
02747     return rc;
02748 
02749   
02750   if ( rc = nfs_remote_mkdir( &subdir_hdl, file, mode, &new_hdl,output))
02751     return rc;
02752       
02753 
02754   if( flag_v )
02755   {
02756     char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
02757     snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,(caddr_t)new_hdl.data_val ,
02758                 new_hdl.data_len ) ;
02759     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully created.\n(handle=@%s)\n",glob_path,file, buff ) ;
02760   }
02761 
02762   return 0;  
02763 
02764 
02765 }
02766 
02767 
02769 int fn_nfs_remote_unlink(
02770                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02771                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02772                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02773                   )
02774 {
02775   static char format[]="hv";
02776    
02777   static char help_unlink[]=
02778   "usage: unlink [-h][-v] <path>\n"
02779   "       path: path of the directory to be unlinkd\n";
02780   
02781   char glob_path_parent[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02782   char glob_path_object[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02783   shell_fh3_t subdir_hdl ;
02784   shell_fh3_t obj_hdl ; 
02785   fattr3 attrs; 
02786   int rc,option;
02787   int flag_v=0;
02788   int flag_h=0;
02789   int err_flag=0;
02790   
02791   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
02792   char * path;
02793   char * file;
02794   
02795   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02796   
02797   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02798   {
02799     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02800     return -1 ;
02801   }
02802   
02803   /* analysing options */
02804   getopt_init();
02805   while ( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1){   
02806     switch( option )
02807       {
02808       case 'v':
02809         if( flag_v )
02810           fprintf( output, "unlink: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02811         else flag_v++;
02812         break;
02813         
02814       case 'h':
02815         if( flag_h )
02816           fprintf( output, "unlink: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02817         else flag_h++;
02818         break;
02819         
02820       case '?':
02821         fprintf( output,"unlink: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
02822         err_flag ++;
02823         break;
02824     }    
02825   }
02826   
02827   if( flag_h )
02828     {
02829       fprintf( output, help_unlink);
02830       return 0;
02831     }
02832   
02833   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
02834   if( Optind != ( argc - 1 ) )
02835     {
02836       err_flag ++;
02837     }
02838   else 
02839     {
02840       strncpy( tmp_path, argv[Optind], NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02841       split_path( tmp_path, &path, &file);      
02842     }
02843   
02844   /* copy current path. */
02845   strncpy( glob_path_parent, current_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02846   
02847   /* retrieves parent dir handle*/
02848   if (rc = nfs_remote_solvepath( &mounted_path_hdl, glob_path_parent, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
02849                           path, &current_path_hdl, &subdir_hdl,output) )
02850     return rc;
02851 
02852    /* copy parent path */
02853    strncpy( glob_path_object, glob_path_parent, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN );
02854    
02855    /* lookup on child object */
02856    if (rc = nfs_remote_solvepath( &mounted_path_hdl, glob_path_object, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
02857                           file, &subdir_hdl, &obj_hdl, output) )
02858     return rc;
02859     
02860    /* get attributes of child object */
02861    if( flag_v )
02862       fprintf(output,"Getting attributes for %s...\n",glob_path_object );
02863 
02864    if ( rc = nfs_remote_getattr( &obj_hdl, &attrs, output ) ) return rc;
02865 
02866     if ( attrs.type != NF3DIR )
02867     {
02868       if( flag_v )
02869         fprintf(output,"%s is not a directory: calling nfs3_remove...\n",glob_path_object );
02870       
02871       if ( rc = nfs_remote_remove( &subdir_hdl, file, output))
02872         return rc;
02873     }
02874     else
02875     {
02876       if( flag_v )
02877         fprintf(output,"%s is a directory: calling nfs3_rmdir...\n",glob_path_object );
02878       
02879       if ( rc = nfs_remote_rmdir( &subdir_hdl, file, output))
02880         return rc;     
02881     }  
02882 
02883   if( flag_v )
02884     fprintf(output,"%s successfully removed.\n",glob_path_object );
02885 
02886   return 0;
02887 
02888 }
02889 
02891 int fn_nfs_remote_setattr( int     argc ,     /* IN : number of args in argv */
02892                             char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02893                             FILE *  output     /* IN : output stream          */ )
02894 {
02895   
02896   static char format[]="hv";
02897    
02898   static char help_setattr[]=
02899     "usage: setattr [-h][-v] <path> <attr>=<value>,<attr>=<value>,...\n"
02900     "       where <attr> can be :\n"
02901     "          mode(octal value),\n"
02902     "          uid, gid, (unsigned 32 bits integer)\n"
02903     "          size, (unsigned  64 bits integer)\n"
02904     "          atime, mtime (format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.nnnnnnnnn)\n";
02905 
02906   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
02907 
02908   shell_fh3_t obj_hdl ;        /* handle of the object    */
02909   sattr3  set_attrs;       /* attributes to be setted */
02910   char * attr_string;
02911   
02912   int rc, option;
02913   int flag_v=0;
02914   int flag_h=0;
02915   int err_flag=0;
02916   
02917   char file[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN]; /* the relative path to the object */
02918        
02919   /* check if a path has been mounted */
02920   
02921   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
02922   {
02923     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
02924     return -1 ;
02925   }
02926     
02927   /* analysing options */
02928   getopt_init() ;
02929   
02930   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format )) != -1 )
02931   {   
02932     switch( option )
02933       {
02934       case 'v':
02935         if( flag_v )
02936           fprintf( output, "setattr: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02937         else 
02938           flag_v++;
02939         break;
02940         
02941       case 'h':
02942         if( flag_h )
02943           fprintf(output, "setattr: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02944         else 
02945           flag_h++;
02946         break;
02947         
02948       case '?':
02949         fprintf(output,"setattr: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02950         err_flag ++;
02951         break;
02952     }    
02953   }
02954   
02955   if( flag_h )
02956     {
02957       /* print usage */
02958       fprintf(output,help_setattr);
02959       return 0;
02960     }
02961   
02962   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02963   
02964   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) )
02965     {
02966       err_flag ++;
02967     } 
02968   else 
02969     {
02970       strcpy( file,  argv[Optind] ) ;
02971       attr_string = argv[Optind+1]; 
02972     }
02973   
02974   if( err_flag )
02975     {
02976       fprintf( output, help_setattr );
02977       return -1;
02978     }
02979   
02980   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
02981   strncpy( glob_path, current_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
02982   
02983   /* retrieve handle to the file whose attributes are to be changed */
02984   if( rc = nfs_remote_solvepath( &mounted_path_hdl, glob_path, NFS2_MAXPATHLEN, file, &current_path_hdl, &obj_hdl, output ) )
02985     return rc ;
02986     
02987   /* Convert the peer (attr_name,attr_val) to an sattr3 structure. */
02988   if ( (rc = cmdnfs_sattr3( CMDNFS_ENCODE,
02989                            1, &attr_string, 0, NULL, (caddr_t)&set_attrs ))
02990       == FALSE )
02991     return rc;
02992 
02993                               
02994   /* executes set attrs */
02995   if ( rc = nfs_remote_setattr( &obj_hdl, &set_attrs, output ) ) return rc;
02996 
02997   if (flag_v)
02998     fprintf(output,"Attributes of \"%s\" successfully changed.\n",glob_path );
02999         
03000   return 0;  
03001 } /* fn_nfs_remote_setattr */
03002 
03003 
03004 
03006 int fn_nfs_remote_rename( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03007         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03008         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
03009       ){
03010   
03011   
03012   static char format[]="hv";
03013    
03014   static char help_rename[]=
03015   "usage: rename [-h][-v] <src> <dest>\n";
03016 
03017   char src_glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03018   char tgt_glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03019   
03020   shell_fh3_t src_path_handle, tgt_path_handle;
03021   
03022   int rc,option;
03023   int flag_v=0;
03024   int flag_h=0;
03025   int err_flag=0;
03026   
03027   char tmp_path1[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03028   char tmp_path2[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03029   char * src_path;
03030   char * src_file;
03031   char * tgt_path;
03032   char * tgt_file;
03033       
03034   /* check if a path has been mounted */
03035   
03036   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
03037   {
03038     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
03039     return -1 ;
03040   }
03041   
03042   /* analysing options */
03043   getopt_init();
03044   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
03045     switch(option){
03046       case 'v':
03047         if (flag_v)
03048           fprintf(output,
03049               "rename: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03050         else flag_v++;
03051         break;
03052       case 'h':
03053         if ( flag_h )
03054           fprintf(output,
03055               "rename: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03056         else flag_h++;
03057         break;
03058       case '?':
03059         fprintf(output,"rename: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03060         err_flag ++;
03061         break;
03062     }    
03063   }
03064   
03065   if (flag_h){
03066     fprintf(output,help_rename);
03067     return 0;
03068   }
03069   
03070   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
03071   if (Optind != (argc-2)){
03072     err_flag ++;
03073   } else {
03074     
03075     strncpy(tmp_path1,argv[Optind],NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03076     split_path(tmp_path1,&src_path,&src_file);
03077 
03078     strncpy(tmp_path2,argv[Optind+1],NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03079     split_path(tmp_path2,&tgt_path,&tgt_file);
03080     
03081   }
03082   
03083   if (err_flag){
03084     fprintf(output,help_rename);
03085     return -1;
03086   }
03087   
03088   if (flag_v)
03089     fprintf(output,"Renaming %s (dir %s) to %s (dir %s)\n",
03090         src_file,src_path,tgt_file,tgt_path);
03091   
03092   /* copy current path. */
03093   strncpy(src_glob_path,current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03094   strncpy(tgt_glob_path,current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03095   
03096   /* retrieves paths handles */
03097   if (rc = 
03098       nfs_remote_solvepath(&mounted_path_hdl, src_glob_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03099                 src_path, &current_path_hdl,&src_path_handle,output))
03100     return rc;
03101 
03102   if (rc = 
03103       nfs_remote_solvepath(&mounted_path_hdl, tgt_glob_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03104                 tgt_path, &current_path_hdl,&tgt_path_handle,output))
03105     return rc;
03106 
03107   
03108   /* Rename operation */  
03109   
03110   if ( rc = nfs_remote_rename(
03111     &src_path_handle,      /* IN */
03112     src_file,              /* IN */
03113     &tgt_path_handle,      /* IN */
03114     tgt_file,              /* IN */
03115     output ) ) return rc;
03116   
03117 
03118   if (flag_v)
03119     fprintf( output,"%s/%s successfully renamed to %s/%s\n",
03120           src_glob_path, src_file,
03121           tgt_glob_path, tgt_file
03122         );
03123 
03124   return 0;
03125   
03126 }
03127 
03128 
03129 
03130 
03132 int fn_nfs_remote_hardlink( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03133         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03134         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
03135       ){
03136   
03137   
03138   static char format[]="hv";
03139    
03140   static char help_hardlink[]=
03141   "hardlink: create a hard link.\n"
03142   "usage: hardlink [-h][-v] <target> <new_path>\n"
03143   "       target: path of an existing file.\n"
03144   "       new_path: path of the hardlink to be created\n";
03145 
03146   char glob_path_target[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03147   char glob_path_link[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03148   
03149   shell_fh3_t target_hdl, dir_hdl;
03150   
03151   int rc,option;
03152   int flag_v=0;
03153   int flag_h=0;
03154   int err_flag=0;
03155   
03156   char * target = NULL;
03157   
03158   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03159   char * path;
03160   char * name;
03161       
03162   /* check if a path has been mounted */
03163   
03164   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
03165   {
03166     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
03167     return -1 ;
03168   }
03169   
03170   /* analysing options */
03171   getopt_init();
03172   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
03173     switch(option){
03174       case 'v':
03175         if (flag_v)
03176           fprintf(output,
03177               "hardlink: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03178         else flag_v++;
03179         break;
03180       case 'h':
03181         if ( flag_h )
03182           fprintf(output,
03183               "hardlink: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03184         else flag_h++;
03185         break;
03186       case '?':
03187         fprintf(output,"hardlink: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03188         err_flag ++;
03189         break;
03190     }    
03191   }
03192   
03193   if (flag_h){
03194     fprintf(output,help_hardlink);
03195     return 0;
03196   }
03197   
03198   /* 2 args expected */
03199   
03200   if ( Optind == (argc-2) ){
03201     
03202     target = argv[Optind];
03203     
03204     strncpy(tmp_path,argv[Optind+1],NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03205     split_path(tmp_path,&path,&name);
03206 
03207   } else {    
03208     err_flag ++;    
03209   }
03210   
03211   
03212   if (err_flag){
03213     fprintf(output,help_hardlink);
03214     return -1;
03215   }
03216     
03217   /* copy current path. */
03218   strncpy(glob_path_target,current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03219   strncpy(glob_path_link,current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03220   
03221   /* retrieves path handle for target */
03222   if (rc = 
03223       nfs_remote_solvepath(&mounted_path_hdl, glob_path_target,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03224                 target,&current_path_hdl,&target_hdl,output))
03225     return rc;
03226 
03227   /* retrieves path handle for parent dir */
03228   if (rc = 
03229       nfs_remote_solvepath(&mounted_path_hdl, glob_path_link,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03230                 path,&current_path_hdl,&dir_hdl,output))
03231     return rc;
03232   
03233   
03234 
03235   rc = nfs_remote_link(
03236                  &target_hdl,   /* IN - target file */
03237                  &dir_hdl,      /* IN - parent dir handle */
03238                  name,          /* IN - link name */
03239                  output );      /* IN */
03240   
03241   if ( rc ) return rc;
03242 
03243   if (flag_v)
03244     fprintf(output,"%s/%s <=> %s successfully created\n",path,name,glob_path_target);
03245       
03246   return 0;
03247   
03248 }
03249 
03250 
03251 
03254 int fn_nfs_remote_ln( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03255         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03256         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
03257       ){
03258   
03259   
03260   static char format[]="hv";
03261    
03262   static char help_ln[]=
03263   "ln: create a symbolic link.\n"
03264   "usage: ln [-h][-v] <link_content> <link_path>\n"
03265   "       link_content: content of the symbolic link to be created\n"
03266   "       link_path: path of the symbolic link to be created\n";
03267 
03268   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03269   shell_fh3_t path_hdl,link_hdl;
03270   sattr3 set_attrs;
03271   int rc,option;
03272   int flag_v=0;
03273   int flag_h=0;
03274   int err_flag=0;
03275   
03276   char * content = NULL;
03277   char tmp_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03278   char * path;
03279   char * name;
03280     
03281   /* check if a path has been mounted */
03282   
03283   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
03284   {
03285     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
03286     return -1 ;
03287   }
03288   
03289   /* analysing options */
03290   getopt_init();
03291   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
03292     switch(option){
03293       case 'v':
03294         if (flag_v)
03295           fprintf(output,
03296               "ln: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03297         else flag_v++;
03298         break;
03299       case 'h':
03300         if ( flag_h )
03301           fprintf(output,
03302               "ln: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03303         else flag_h++;
03304         break;
03305       case '?':
03306         fprintf(output,"ln: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03307         err_flag ++;
03308         break;
03309     }    
03310   }
03311   
03312   if (flag_h){
03313     fprintf(output,help_ln);
03314     return 0;
03315   }
03316   
03317   /* 2 args expected */
03318   
03319   if ( Optind == (argc-2) ){
03320     
03321     content = argv[Optind];
03322     
03323     strncpy(tmp_path,argv[Optind+1],NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03324     split_path(tmp_path,&path,&name);
03325 
03326   } else {
03327     err_flag ++;
03328   }
03329   
03330   
03331   if (err_flag){
03332     fprintf(output,help_ln);
03333     return -1;
03334   }
03335     
03336   /* copy current path. */
03337   strncpy(glob_path,current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03338   
03339   /* retrieves path handle*/
03340   if (rc = 
03341       nfs_remote_solvepath( &mounted_path_hdl, glob_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03342                      path,&current_path_hdl,&path_hdl,output))
03343     return rc;
03344 
03345   
03346   /* Prepare link attributes : empty sattr3 list */
03347   
03348   if ( cmdnfs_sattr3( CMDNFS_ENCODE, 0, NULL, 0, NULL,
03349                  (caddr_t)&set_attrs ) == FALSE )
03350   {
03351     /* invalid handle */
03352     fprintf( output, "\tError encoding nfs arguments.\n" );
03353     return -1 ;
03354   }
03355   
03356   
03357 
03358   rc = nfs_remote_symlink(
03359                  path_hdl,   /* IN - parent dir handle */
03360                  name,       /* IN - link name */
03361                  content,    /* IN - link content */
03362                  &set_attrs, /* Link attributes */
03363                  &link_hdl,  /* OUT - link handle*/
03364                  output );
03365   
03366   if (rc) return rc;
03367   
03368   if (flag_v)
03369   {
03370     char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1];
03371     snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1,(caddr_t)link_hdl.data_val ,
03372                 link_hdl.data_len );
03373   
03374     fprintf(output,"%s/%s -> %s successfully created (@%s) \n",path,name,content,buff);
03375   }
03376       
03377   return 0;  
03378 }
03379 
03380 
03381 
03382 
03384 int  fn_nfs_remote_stat( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03385                 char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03386                 FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
03387 {
03388   shell_fh3_t handle_tmp;
03389   fattr3 attrs;
03390       
03391   int rc = 0 ;
03392   char glob_path[NFS2_MAXPATHLEN];
03393 
03394   static char format[]="hvHz";
03395   static char help_stat[]="usage: stat [options] <path>\n"
03396     "options :\n"
03397     "\t-h print this help\n"
03398     "\t-v verbose mode\n"
03399     "\t-H print the NFS handle\n" 
03400     "\t-z silent mode (print nothing)\n" ;
03401   
03402   int option;
03403   char * str_name = NULL;
03404   int flag_v = 0;
03405   int flag_h = 0;
03406   int flag_H = 0 ;
03407   int flag_z = 0 ;
03408   int err_flag = 0;
03409 
03410   /* check if a path has been mounted */
03411   
03412   if ( is_mounted_path != TRUE )
03413   {
03414     fprintf( output, "\t%s: no mounted path. Use \"mount\" command first.\n",argv[0] );
03415     return -1 ;
03416   }
03417   
03418     
03419   /* analysing options */
03420   getopt_init();
03421 
03422   while ( (option = Getopt(argc, argv, format) ) != -1)
03423     {   
03424       switch( option )
03425         {
03426         case 'v':
03427           if (flag_v)
03428             fprintf(output,
03429                     "stat: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03430           else 
03431             flag_v++;
03432           break;
03433           
03434         case 'h':
03435           if ( flag_h )
03436             fprintf(output,
03437                     "stat: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03438           else 
03439             flag_h++;
03440           break;
03441           
03442         case 'z':
03443           if ( flag_z )
03444             fprintf(output,
03445                     "stat: warning: option 'z' has been specified more than once.\n");
03446           else 
03447             flag_z++;
03448           break;
03449 
03450         case 'H':
03451           if( flag_H )
03452             fprintf(output,
03453                     "stat: warning: option 'H' has been specified more than once.\n");
03454           else 
03455             flag_H++;
03456           break;
03457           
03458         case '?':
03459           fprintf(output,"stat: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03460           err_flag ++;
03461           break;
03462         }
03463     } /* while */
03464   
03465   if( flag_z + flag_v > 1 )
03466     {
03467       fprintf( output, "stat: can't use -z and -v at the same time\n" ) ;
03468       err_flag ++ ;
03469     }
03470   
03471   if( flag_h )
03472     {
03473       fprintf(output,help_stat);
03474       return 0;
03475     }
03476     
03477   if( Optind != argc -1 )
03478     {
03479       fprintf( output, "stat: Missing argument: <path>\n" ) ;
03480       err_flag ++;
03481     }
03482   else
03483    {
03484      str_name = argv[Optind];
03485    }
03486   
03487   if( err_flag )
03488     {
03489       fprintf(output,help_stat);
03490       return -1;
03491     }
03492   
03493   /* copy current global path */
03494   strncpy(glob_path,current_path,NFS2_MAXPATHLEN);
03495 
03496   /* retrieving handle */
03497   if (rc = nfs_remote_solvepath( &mounted_path_hdl,
03498                                  glob_path,
03499                                  NFS2_MAXPATHLEN,
03500                                  str_name, 
03501                                  &current_path_hdl, 
03502                                  &handle_tmp,
03503                                  output))
03504   
03505   if( flag_v )
03506     fprintf(output,"proceeding stat (using NFS protocol) on \"%s\"\n", glob_path );
03507   
03508   if ( rc = nfs_remote_getattr( &handle_tmp, &attrs, output ) ) return rc;
03509   
03510   if ( flag_H )
03511   {
03512     if( !flag_z )
03513       {
03514         char buff[2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1] ;
03515 
03516         snprintmem( buff, 2*NFS3_FHSIZE+1, (caddr_t)handle_tmp.data_val ,
03517                     handle_tmp.data_len ) ;
03518         fprintf( output, "%s (@%s)\n", str_name, buff ) ;
03519       }
03520   }
03521   else if( !flag_z )
03522   {
03523     fprintf(output,"%s :\n",str_name);
03524     print_nfs_attributes( &attrs, output );
03525   }
03526   
03527   return 0;
03528 } /* fn_nfs_remote_stat */
03529 
03530 
03531 
03532 
03534 int fn_nfs_remote_su( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03535                char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03536                FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
03537 {
03538   int  i;
03539   char * str_uid;
03540   uid_t uid;
03541   struct passwd * pw_struct;
03542   
03543 #define MAX_GRPS  128
03544   gid_t   groups_tab[MAX_GRPS];
03545   int     nb_grp;
03546 
03547   static char help_su[]=
03548   "usage: su <uid>\n";
03549 
03550   prog_vers_client_def_t * clnts = progvers_clnts;
03551   AUTH * auth;
03552       
03553   /* UID arg expected */
03554   if ( argc != 2 )
03555   {
03556     fprintf(output,help_su);
03557     return -1;
03558   }
03559   else
03560   {
03561     str_uid = argv[1];
03562   }
03563 
03564   
03565   if ( isdigit( str_uid[0] ) )
03566   {
03567     if ( (uid = my_atoi(str_uid)) == (uid_t)-1 )
03568     {
03569       fprintf(output,"Error: invalid uid \"%s\"\n",str_uid);
03570       return -1;
03571     }
03572     pw_struct = getpwuid(uid); 
03573   }
03574   else
03575   {
03576     pw_struct = getpwnam( str_uid );
03577   }
03578   
03579   if ( pw_struct == NULL )
03580   {
03581     fprintf( output, "Unknown user %s\n", str_uid );
03582     return errno;
03583   }
03584   
03585   nb_grp = getugroups( MAX_GRPS, groups_tab, pw_struct->pw_name, pw_struct->pw_gid );
03586   
03587   fprintf( output, "Changing user to : %s ( uid = %d, gid = %d )\n",
03588        pw_struct->pw_name , pw_struct->pw_uid, pw_struct->pw_gid );
03589   
03590   if ( nb_grp > 1 )
03591   {
03592     fprintf( output, "altgroups = ");
03593     for ( i = 1; i < nb_grp; i++ )
03594     {      
03595       if ( i == 1 )
03596         fprintf( output, "%d", groups_tab[i]);
03597       else
03598         fprintf( output, ", %d", groups_tab[i]);      
03599     }
03600     fprintf( output, "\n");
03601   }
03602 
03603   auth = authunix_create(localmachine, pw_struct->pw_uid, pw_struct->pw_gid, nb_grp, groups_tab);
03604   if (auth == NULL) {
03605     fprintf(stdout, "su %s : error during creating Auth\n", pw_struct->pw_name);
03606   }
03607   while (clnts->name != NULL) {
03608     if (clnts->clnt != NULL) {
03609       clnts->clnt->cl_auth = auth;
03610     }
03611     clnts ++;
03612   }
03613   memcpy(current_pw, pw_struct, sizeof(struct passwd));
03614   
03615   fprintf(output,"Done.\n");
03616   
03617   return 0;
03618   
03619 }
03620 
03621 int fn_nfs_remote_id( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03622                       char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03623                       FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
03624 {
03625   fprintf(output, "Current user : %s ( uid = %d, gid = %d )\n",
03626        current_pw->pw_name , current_pw->pw_uid, current_pw->pw_gid );
03627 
03628   return 0;
03629 }
